sentences.sentence: Ukrainian pilots are set to get F-16 training from the United States as Ukraine steps up its counter-offensive.

sentences.sentence: Mistakes? He made a few. Vladimir Putin pays tribute to the mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin, a man he'd known personally since the 1990s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The United States has said it will begin to train Ukrainian pilots how to fly F-16 fighter jets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, the Pentagon said they'd begin with English language lessons in September and provide in-flight training in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The move comes as Denmark and Netherlands announce they'd send F-16s to Ukraine after Washington gave the go-ahead to send third-party fighter jets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And Norway's prime minister has agreed to do the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When the United States gave a green light to training of pilots and all the infrastructure around, Norway immediately supported that pledge and Norwegian trainers are taking part with the other countries working on this together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Ukraine says it has destroyed a Russian surface-to-air missile defense system in Crimea. And video footage appears to show special forces raising the Ukrainian flag in Russian-annexed Crimea following special joint operations in the region.

sentences.sentence: In life, a vocal and sometimes ferocious critic of Russia's generals. In death, a demise confirmed by the President himself, Yevgeny Prigozhin was a much-missed

Non ci siamo trovati di fronte alla vera difficoltà di dover gestire grandi numeri per l'impossibilità di trasferimenti. Questi trasferimenti avvengono in maniera regolare e ci permettono anche di bilanciare partenze con nuovi arrivi. Ci aggiriamo intorno alle 110-120 unità ogni giorno, che includono dipendenti e volontari di Croce Rossa con varie specializzazioni e vari percorsi di formazione.

sentences.sentence: Giorgia Orlandi, Euronews, Lampedusa. Turkey's central bank has raised its key interest rate to 25%.

sentences.sentence: That's an increase of 7.5% and is being seen as a sign of a return to more conventional economic policies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It backtracks from a rate-cutting course set by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, which had been blamed by some economists for inflaming a cost-of-living crisis.

sentences.sentence: Many households in Turkey have been struggling to cover the cost of rent and basic goods as inflation surged. Analysts are predicting investors will be reassured by the move. Residents of the Greek town of Avas returned to see the ruins of their

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's a controversial decision drawing significant criticism. On Thursday, Japan began discharging wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear power plant into

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: the Pacific Ocean.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The discharge is considered a necessary step towards decommissioning the plant, which was destroyed by a tsunami in 2011.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Japanese government was given the green light by the UN nuclear watchdog, which says the water was treated and safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: However, there are many in Japan who believe otherwise and are publicly expressing their disapproval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Many gathered in Tokyo on Wednesday to protest the plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's a concern shared by Japan's neighbours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: South Korea saw multiple protests erupt over the discharge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And the seafood markets are also worried. Consumers' distrust of the fish and seafood harvested in this shared sea could sink sales. A survey found that 80% of respondents opposed the Japanese plan while 60% said they wouldn't eat seafood after the water release began. The Chinese government has called the spill an act of selfishness and has banned all imports of Japanese seafood without ruling out further measures to safeguard food safety for the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Emperor penguins depend on stable sea ice to raise chicks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But as seen here, sea ice in Antarctica eroded by record levels in 2022, causing young penguins to fall into freezing water and ultimately killing all of the chicks that lived in this area. That's according to research released by the British Antarctica Survey. Experts know the sea ice levels in 2022 completely disappeared. The key finding is that emperor penguins nest on sea ice and they need that substrate to last beyond December in order to support their breeding season successfully. So if it breaks up earlier than early December, the chicks will actually fall into the sea and they will drown. If they manage to scramble out of the sea, their plumage will be wetted and they'll die of hypothermia. Alternatively, they may be able to stay on ice flows, but they drift away and then the parents can't find them and they all starve to death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: While it's possible for the population to recover from one or two bad breeding years, there is worry about the penguins' future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: According to the World Wildlife Fund, around 80% of emperor penguin colonies are expected to be quasi-extinct by the end of the century because of climate change.
